intro: Cyclopia ashtonii, commonly known as the ashtonii cyclopia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is adapted to arid conditions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
